content: Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 18 Mar 2019If you’re using a Robo-advisor, are the shares bought under your name or a custodian account?2 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

HC Tang, Financial Enthusiast, Budgeting at The SocietyLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 18 Mar 2019Custodian account.Eg. Stashway:
Your cash deposits are held at a Trust Account at DBS Bank while your investable cash and securities are held in a custodian account through Saxo Capital Markets Pte Ltd Source:  https://www.stashaway.sg/faq/115003871648-where-is-my-money-kept In practice, if both StashAway and Saxo go bankrupt, customers’ holdings are still safe. The fact that MAS awarded to Stashaway a full CMS license for Fund Management and that therefore they need to comply to very strict audit, compliance and minimum capital requirements should give comfort to investors.0 comments1
Sylves AngLevel 2. RookieAnswered on 18 Mar 2019It is under custodian account under the robo advisory firm. Hope this clarify.0 comments0
